original_title: Sri Lanka to extend maturities, clip coupons of rupee bonds: Minister
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka will extend maturities and clip coupons of rupee bonds involved in a re-structure but no principal reduction is planned, State Minister for Finance Ranjith Siyambalapitya said.
“There will only be maturity extension and reductions in interest,” Minister Siyambalapitiya told parliament Tuesday.
“The government conducting in-depth analysis to ensure that there is no undue burden on the people.”
The stability of the banking system will be maintained, he said.
“There fears expressed that bank deposits will be cut off or pension funds will be cut off. There is nothing like that.”
Sri Lanka has already said that Treasury bills will not be re-structured except for those held by the central bank.
Sri Lanka has to at least extend maturities of rupee bonds to meet a gross financing need (total deficit financing and roll-overs) from 2027.
When a bond portfolio in banks are re-structured they get a so-called ‘first day hit’ as securities in held-to-maturity portfolios at historical cost are exchanged for the re-structured instrument.
It is expected that accounting forbearance will be given in case that happens, analysts say.
